text:
Absolutely no functional bugs here, just typo's and so on.

Typo's:

org.apache.log4j.Appender:
  Line [15]: That line should probably be taken out.

org.apache.log4j.Category:
  Line [43]: "hierarchal" should be "hierarchical".
  Line [69]: "undescore" should be "underscore".

org.apache.log4j.HTMLLayout:
  Line [170]: "layoout" should be "layout".
  Line [202]: "prinln" should be "println".

org.apache.log4j.PropertyConfigurator:
  Line [123]: "log" should be "log4j". :) Same with lines 124 and 126.
  Line [193]: "renreder" should be "renderer".

org.apache.log4j.net.SocketServer:
  Line [26]: "hiearchy" should be "hierarchy". Same with 158.

deepExtension.html
  Line [473]: "instanciated" should be "instantiated". Same with line 711.

FAQ.html:
  Line [212]: "PattenLayout" should be "PatternLayout".
  Line [258]: "PropertiesConfigurator" should be "PropertyConfigurator".
  Line [277]: "codeI" should be "code".
  Line [400]: "implenent" should be "implement".
  Line [553]: "developement" should be "development".

manual.html:
  Line [896]: "has a many features" should be "has many features".
  Line [902]: "performace" should be "performance".

factor.lcf:
  Line [1]: "propperty" should be "property".
            "caonfiguration" should be "configuration".
            Same with sort1.lcf, sort2.lcf and sort3.lcf.

Also:

  troubleshoot.html cuts off at the end.

  The FAQ in some places has hyperlinks (Line 503 - AppenderSkeleton),
  and sometimes just uses the code tags (Line 479 - NumberCruncher),
  which makes it a little inconsistent.

  The hyperlink in the Category class to the user manual (line 45), is
  invalid, at least in the offline documentation. However, since at the
  time of writing, I'm not online, so it's possible that the online
  documentation have a different tree structure to the offline version.
creator: amc1@dcs.qmw.ac.uk
bugzilla@apache.org
text: Thanks Allan. I corrected all the typos you pointed out. Ceki
